For 45 days I supported our efforts at the southwest border. This experience was one of the most rewarding & eye-opening events in my career with @USCIS. I am thankful for the opportunity & trust I helped to make a difference. #EOAnniversary

The border patrol agents would ask me to assist in translating & help the children assimilate to their surroundings. I would partner them up with other children that might be able to be a friend throughout their journey in this new life experience.
I made it my daily task to ensure that these young moms had access to newborn clothing, powder milk, baby food, & toys. I believe I made a difference in the lives of these young children and moms.

The most heart wrenching experiences for me were seeing babies as young as 2 months old, coming in with their young mothers. As a mother myself of a young infant that I had back at home, I knew the struggles and support these young mothers needed.

A typical morning for me involved ensuring that the children knew where to access toiletry supplies, snacks, & change of clothing. I made sure throughout the day that the kids were able to watch movies in their pods, had games & coloring supplies, & I spent time talking to them.

I was detailed to Tucson, Arizona and stationed at a facility there to help support unaccompanied children. As a native Spanish speaker I had the advantage of being able to communicate and provide assistance to these young children who were typically between 5 & 16 years old. https://t.co/yAAJjz9KEA

When you do good work, it is reflected back to you. Our work was recognized by all of the children. There is no greater humanitarian effort than defending those who cannot defend themselves. #EOAnniversary

Even that pales in comparison to the greatest reward – reuniting separated families. I will never forget the embrace from one child I worked with when he was reunited with his parents, nor will I forget the parents who personally called to thank me for caring for their children.

There is no greater responsibility than taking care of children, especially someone else’s. One of the biggest highlights was helping a child who had dentures but no way to clean them or reattach them. I worked hard to get the proper supplies he needed so he could eat again.

Unaccompanied minors are the most vulnerable population arriving at the Southern Border. urls.title: USCIS Announces New Agency Mission Statement
urls.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director Ur M. Jaddou announced the agency’s new mission statement. Last year, USCIS leadership empowered employees to submit words that they felt best illustrated the agency’s work. The new mission statement is a reflection of this feedback from the workforce, the priorities of the Biden Administration, and Director Jaddou’s vision for an inclusive and accessible agency.

The supplemental H-2B visa allocation consists of 13,500 visas available only to returning workers who received an H-2B visa, or were otherwise granted H-2B status, during one of the last three fiscal years (FY 2019, 2020, or 2021).
